overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to forecasting a short time series with suspected daily seasonality. After considering complex models like SARIMA and Exponential Smoothing, the analyst defaults to a simple averaging method due to data limitations (only 96 points). The approach prioritizes interpretability and computational simplicity, explicitly acknowledging trade-offs in pattern capture while maintaining data consistency through rounding and date formatting.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
key_insights: Short time series (4 days) limits complex model applicability despite observed seasonality
Hourly averaging provides a robust baseline for repeating daily patterns in forecasts
Data rounding maintains consistency with original precision requirements
Explicit handling of datetime formatting ensures output alignment with input structure
complexity_analysis: Moderate initial complexity with model evaluation, simplifying to heuristic execution due to data constraints. Balances statistical awareness with practical implementation trade-offs.
